name: manse
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
especially in Scotland, a house in which a minister of a church lives, provided by the church: The manse is just next to the church. He was brought up in a Church of Scotland manse.
US a large house with a lot of land: The four-bedroom manse features Italian-marble floors, tennis court, wine cellar and, of course, hair salon. She still lives in the family's rambling manse on Fayerweather Street.
More examplesFewer examplesThe Church and manse were erected in 1860.At that time, very few churches provided manses.We pulled up in front of a lovely brick Georgian manse.He bought himself a $6.25-million manse in Beverly Hills after they broke up.
